column4: Could there be an error with Ubuntu if I can't play movie files, but a command from the CLI works?
Could there be an error with Ubuntu if I can't play movie files, but a command from the CLI works?
what movie files and what command?
ogg files and lemme find it
ogg files and mplayer -vo x11 out.ogg
well ogg ought to work out of the box - and totem (Movie Player) won't play it?
Nope, it opens, then closes instantly.
Nope, it opens, then closes instantly.
hmm odd, is this a fresh install - have you changed anything?
I have had some odd problems lately, when I got to log in, I chaned session thingy to GNOME.
when you got to log in?
I mean what do you mean?
ah, you have to manually choose gnome?
It stops doing anything and splash screen doesn't load, making Ubuntu not load. However, I was about to try and restart, should I?
what do you mean by restart? reboot or reinstall? and did you change anything before this started happening?
has a reboot changed anything before?
Well, TBH, the last time I did is when problem started...I shall try it again though
